local-authority-contacted-about-child.header: Which local authority have you contacted about the child?
local-authority-contacted-about-child.paragraph-1: You must contact the relevant local authority to safeguard the child before continuing.
local-authority-contacted-about-child.paragraph-2: If the child is in an Independent Child Trafficking Guardian (ICTG) area you will also need to refer them to the

what-is-their-background.header: Tell us about the potential victim's background

potential-victim-exploitative-situation-.header: Has the potential victim been in more than one exploitative situation?

when-did-the-exploitation-take-place.intro: If the potential victim doesn't know exact start and end dates, ask for a loose time frame (such as a month or year), how old they were, or if it was a recent incident.

when-did-the-exploitation-take-place-mul.warning: Later in the service, we will ask you for more details about the multiple exploitations, including modern slavery indicators and how much the potential victim was treated.

how-did-the-exploitation-start.paragraph: Explore what promises were made, what they were expecting to do, and what pay was promised.

were-they-taken-somewhere-by-their-explo.header: Was the potential victim taken somewhere by their exploiters?
were-they-taken-somewhere-by-their-explo.additional-hint-1: Tell us about any journeys the potential victim was taken on, how it began and what transport was used.
were-they-taken-somewhere-by-their-explo.additional-hint-2: Include any details the potential victim remembers about how and where they have been transported, including any routes, places, landmark features, or times.

how-they-were-treated.header: How was the potential victim treated during their exploitation?

reasons-preventing-potential-victim-from.header: What is keeping the potential victim in the situation?
reasons-preventing-potential-victim-from.intro: Include what reasons are preventing them from leaving the situation. For example, withheld documents, fear for their own or their family's safety or debt.
reasons-preventing-potential-victim-from.warning: If you identify a potential victim of modern slavery, follow the safeguarding procedures set out by your organisation.

how-why-did-they-leave-the-situation.header: How did the potential victim leave the exploitative situation?

details-last-contact.paragraph-1: To assess the risk that the potential victim may be exploited or trafficked again, we need to know about any communication between them and their exploiters.
details-last-contact.paragraph-2: You can upload any files as supporting evidence at the end of this service.
details-last-contact.bullet-1: how they communicated and what was said
details-last-contact.bullet-3: any threats that the exploiters made
details-last-contact.bullet-4: if the potential victim has taken any steps to prevent contact with their exploiters

why-report-now.header: Is there anything that prevented the potential victim from reporting this sooner?
why-report-now.intro: Using your professional judgement, tell us about any reasons why they have not reported this until now. For example. emotional distress or trauma.

modern-slavery-indicators.modern-slavery-indicators-paragraph-1: If you identified modern slavery indicators provide details.
modern-slavery-indicators.modern-slavery-indicators-paragraph-2: See section 3 'Identifying potential victims of modern slavery' for examples of modern slavery indicators. Include context about where you noticed these indicators.

professional-insight.intro: Using your professional judgement, provide any relevant information about why you are making this referral.

evidence-of-dishonesty.header: Do you have any concerns about the potential victim's credibility?

are-others-involved.header: Are there other professionals or organisations involved with this case?

where-exploitation-happened-uk.header: Where was the potential victim exploited in the UK?
where-exploitation-happened-uk.paragraph-1: If the exploitation happened in more than one location, add each one. If you cannot find the city or town on the list, enter 'Unknown'.
where-exploitation-happened-uk.paragraph-2: Provide any location details, such as the name of a village, in the 'Address or location' box.
where-exploitation-happened-uk.select-overseas-note: Once you press continue you will be able to add more details about the overseas locations.

where-exploitation-happened-overseas.header: Where was the potential victim exploited overseas?
where-exploitation-happened-overseas.paragraph-1: If the exploitation happened in more than one location, add each one. If you cannot find the country on the list, enter 'Unknown'.
where-exploitation-happened-overseas.paragraph-2: Provide any location details, such as the name of a village, in the 'Address or location' box.

current-pv-location.header: Where is the potential victim staying?

exploiters-current-location-details.header: What information do you have about where the exploiters are now?

types-of-exploitation.warning: If you think they are a victim of another crime you can report it to the police by calling 101.

any-other-pvs.header: Were there any other potential victims?

concerns-future-exploitation.header: Why are there concerns about exploitation in the future?

reported-to-police.header: Do they have a crime reference number related to any reported Modern Slavery crime, in which they are a victim?

authorities-cooperation.paragraph-1: The UK public authorities (such as law enforcement agencies) may investigate or undertake criminal proceedings into any incidents you’ve reported in this referral.

pv-want-to-submit-nrm.header: Does the potential victim consent to having their case reffered to the NRM?
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.warning: Potential victims need to give informed consent to enter the National Referral Mechanism (NRM) and access support.

refuse-nrm.header: Why doesn't the potential victim want their case referred to the NRM?

does-pv-need-support.header: Does the potential victim want support?
does-pv-need-support.warning: Make sure you contact the support provider (opens in new tab) as soon as possible if the potential victim needs emergency housing.
does-pv-need-support.paragraph-1: Support to enable ongoing recovery may include:
does-pv-need-support.support-example-3: someone to help them cope with their experience
does-pv-need-support.support-example-4: protection from the people who exploited them
does-pv-need-support.support-example-5: help to access independent legal advice

pv-phone-number.header: How can the support provider contact the potential victim?
pv-phone-number.alternative-phone-number-text: Enter a telephone number so we can contact the potential victim and explain who this is, for example, a legal representative.
pv-phone-number.alternative-phone-number-warning: Make sure this person is safe to be contacted. Check that these are not the contact details of the exploiters.
pv-phone-number.no-contact-details: Tell us why you cannot provide the potential victim's telephone number, for example you are not longer in contact with them, or they don't have a phone.

pv-name-referral.header: What is the name of the Potential Victim?

pv-name-dtn.header: What is the name of the Potential Victim?

pv-dob.header: What is their date of birth? (Optional)

who-contact.header: Who should we send our decision to?

fr-details.read-only-field-1-hint: This is the address you gave at the start of the form.
fr-details.read-only-field-2-hint: This is the organisation you gave at the start of the form.

fr-alternative-contact.header: Who should we contact in your absence?  (Optional)

what-evidence-you-will-submit.header: Tell us about the documents you uploaded

more-than-one-exploitation-situation.header: Have they been in more than one exploitative situation?
more-than-one-exploitation-situation.paragraph-1: If yes, please make sure that details from all exploitative situations are captured in the following questions.

why-are-you-making-the-referral.header: Why are you making the referral?
why-are-you-making-the-referral.paragraph-1: Include relevant evidence or information, such as:
why-are-you-making-the-referral.paragraph-2: The information you enter is disclosable
why-are-you-making-the-referral.bullet-3: an intention to exploit the individual
why-are-you-making-the-referral.bullet-4: circumstances which put the individual at a heightened level of vulnerability

reference.label: Your reference
reference.hint: This will not be included in the report

how-did-the-exploitation-start.label: How they came to be exploited

what-is-keeping-them-in-situation.label: What is keeping the potential victim in the situation?

when-last-contact.label: When were they last in contact with exploiters

why-report-now.label: Is there anything that prevented the potential victim from reporting this sooner?

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-1.label: Where was the potential victim exploited in the UK?

where-exploitation-happened-overseas-cou.label: Where was the potential victim exploited overseas?

exploiters-current-location-details.label: Information about where exploiters are now

pv-want-to-submit-nrm.label: Case referred to NRM
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.automatic-referral: Automatic referral when potential victim under 18 years old or age unknown

does-pv-need-support.label: Support requested
does-pv-need-support.automatic-referral: Support can not be requested when potential victims under 18 years old

pv-phone-number.label: Permission for support provider to contact them

fr-details-email.label: Email
fr-details-email.info: The email you are using for this report

confirmation.title: Confirmation
confirmation.paragraph-1: You will shortly receive a confirmation email with a reference number. You will also receive a copy of your report for your records.
confirmation.heading-1-paragraph-1: We will look at the potential victim’s case within 5 working days and decide if there are reasonable grounds to believe they are a victim of modern slavery.
confirmation.heading-1-paragraph-2: We may contact you if we need more information.
confirmation.heading-1-paragraph-1-dtn: The information provided will be shared with Police and other law enforcement agencies in order to build a better picture of modern slavery in England and Wales. It will also be used to improve our law enforcement response.
confirmation.heading-2: If the potential victim needs support
confirmation.heading-2-paragraph-1: Support can take up to 5 days to start. If they need help immediately, you’ll need to contact the relevant provider or local authority for more information.
confirmation.heading-3-paragraph-4-link-1: What did you think of this service?

reference.header: What’s your reference for this report?

organisation.header: What organisation do you work for?

send-pdf.header: Enter the email to send the Pdf
